intro: Illicium parvifolium subsp. oligandrum, commonly known as the small-leaved star anise, is a species native to China. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped fruits that are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The plant features simple, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a faintly fragrant scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and medicinal properties.
